awd_titl_txt: Particle and Quantum Field Theory Investigations (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: Research under this grant includes a wide variety of                       topics in particle and quantum field theory.  Alberto Sirlin                    plans calculations which will further improve the comparison                    between theory and experiment in the standard model of                          electroweak interactions (following improvement for beta-decay                  achieved recently), and to extend it to new domains where it                    may reveal the signal of new physics.  Daniel Zwanziger intends                 to investigate non-perturbative phenomena in continuum QCD                      using the formulation of stochastic quantization, to employ a                   recently developed lattice fermion action in numerical                          simulations, and to test the new multi-grid algorithm of Sokal                  and Goodman in lattice gauge theory.                                                 This research is at the frontiers of theoretical physics                   in the areas of elementary particles and field theory.  It                      should help lead to better understanding of both current and                    planned experiments as well as helping to devise deeper                         theories that may in the future be susceptible to experimental                  tests.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
